required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinesio Taping in Muscle Damage Response Induced by Eccentric Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Kinesio Taping® Does Not Interfere in Muscle Damage Response Induced by Eccentric Exercise: a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

clinical_study.source: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

brief_summary.textblock: Sixty volunteers with a mean age of 21,8 ± 2,6 years participated in this study, randomly distributed into one of the following groups: control, Kinesio taping group with tension in the anterior arm region and Kinesio taping group without tension in the same region. All subjects underwent an eccentric exercise protocol and three evaluations: before the protocol, immediately after and 48h after protocol. The following variables were analyzed: sensation of pain as the primary outcome; peak torque normalized by body weight; average peak torque; total work and average power, using an isokinetic dynamometer. In addition, muscle activation amplitude (Root Mean Square) and median frequency were recorded using surface electromyography.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in visual analogue scale at one hour and three days

arm_group.description: No intervention. Remained five minutes at rest.
Apply Kinesio Taping application with tension.

intervention.description: Kinesio Taping application with tension (Kinesio Tex Gold®, Japan) in the anterior region of the non-dominant arm.
Kinesio Taping application without tension (Kinesio Tex Gold®, Japan) in the anterior region of the non-dominant arm.

facility.name: Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte
